body:
Theodore -- The severity of E+ errors can have varying effects on results, so live by the mantra “garbage in = garbage out” when working with energy simulation tools and always clean up your model!

 

Some minor errors simply state that a mathematical impossibility occurred in the calculations, for example, that the RH point dropped below zero.  While other errors signify major issues that need to be addressed before any results are to be trusted.  Adjacency errors, although not fatal, need to be corrected.  For more detailed help with specific errors try the E+ support group over on Yahoo Groups : [https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/EnergyPlus_Support/info](https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/EnergyPlus_Support/info)



Cheers -- J
